intro: Xylopia brasiliensis var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender waxtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and are followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
